page.title: 15THE CATHEDRAL
page.content:
The Cathedral of St.Asaph was founded in 560 by St.Kentigern from Scotland.He landed on the banks of the River Dee and explored the surrounding countryside.
He chose the present site because it was geographically perfect with two rivers and a steep hill to keep away unwanted visitors.Nothing of the original "LLAN" is left.The present structure was mainly built in the 15th century.The Nave was built c.1370.The Quire was rebuilt in the early 1800's to replace the one destroyed by Owain Glyndwr in his rebellion against the English in 1402.The present Bishop is Alwyn Rice Jones and his diocese stretches from Newtown to Queensferry and Llandudno to Bala.
